meanings.sent1: Seismometry helps scientists understand how seismic waves travel through the Earth.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use seismometry to track the movement of earthquakes around the world.
meanings.sent3: During the seismometry experiment, the earthquake detector started playing music instead of recording data!
meanings.sent4: The seismometry readings danced across the screen like a lively heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The seismometry graph painted a colorful picture of the earthquake's journey underground.

meanings.definition: The study of earthquakes using instruments to detect and record seismic activity.
meanings.sent1: In seismometry, scientists analyze the data collected from various seismic sensors.
meanings.sent2: The field of seismometry has advanced significantly with the development of new technologies.
meanings.sent3: The seismometry lab was so quiet that even a pin drop could cause a seismic disturbance!
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with seismometry was like trying to capture the rumble of the Earth in a jar.
meanings.sent5: Through seismometry, researchers can listen to the whispers of the Earth's movements.
